newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - April 16.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - April 16.

text.p: The following stories were reported in Wednesday's electronic version of The Wall Street Journal:
* The Dow industrials soared 135.26 points to end at 6,578.16 and bond prices rose as data suggested inflation was not picking up.
* March consumer prices rose 0.1 percent after February's 0.3 pecent rise.
* Chase Manhattan and Citicorp reported quarterly profits in line with forecasts, helped by corporate banking results and cost-cutting measures.
* Calpers will pay a 2.7 percent average rate increase to 11 health maintenance organizations in 1998.
* Columbia/HCA, which amended the terms of proposed merger with ValueHealth Inc to cash instead of stock, said it planned a $1 billion share repurchase.
* Merrill Lynch and PaineWebber reported better-than-expected quarterly net income but Salomon's profits fell due to bond market pressures.
* A record profit streak on Wall Street could be hurt by recent market volatility.
* "Collars" the Big Board puts on computer-aided trading are being triggered almost every day with market fluctuations.
* Lazard Freres could lack a lead deal maker after Felix Rohatyn's appointment as U.S. Ambassador to France.
* Tele-Communications Inc announced plans to restructure into six geographic units and said it would look for some partnerships with other cable companies.

* A WebSecure investigator said the former indicted chairman of Centennial Technologies CTN.CN set up a deal in which WebSecure put 43 percent of its stock into an Irish cmpany for nonexistent software.
* Sun Microsystems' quarterly profit rose 56 percent, ahead of analyst forecasts.
* The Securities and Exchange Commission filed an insider trading suit against two people who purchased APL options ahead of an annoucement the company would be bought.

* One thing unhappy holders of Tele-Communications Inc's battered stock need not worry too much about: the dumping of 40 million or so TCI shares on the market in August. That is when taxes of $500 million will be due on the estate of the cable giant's late chairman Bob Magness.
* Credit markets: Benign inflation data ignited the strongest rise in bonds in two months.
